Description: Number of days between admission and discharge
Payer identifier
Physician speciality
Indicates if patient has any prothesis.
The patient vaccination status.
Number of lab tests performed during the encounter
Number of procedures (other than lab tests) performed during the encounter
Number of distinct generic names administered during the encounter
Number of outpatient visits of the patient in the year preceding the encounter
Number of emergency visits of the patient in the year preceding the encounter
Number of inpatient visits of the patient in the year preceding the encounter
The primary diagnosis (coded as first three digits of ICD9)
Secondary diagnosis (coded as first three digits of ICD9)
Additional secondary diagnosis (coded as first three digits of ICD9)
Number of diagnoses entered to the system
Patient blood type
Encounter initial patient hemoglobin level (g/dl)
Indicates if pacient required blood transfusion during encounter
Codes:
Yes: blood transfusion was performed during the encounter
No: no blood transfusion was performed during the encounter

Description: Indicates the range of the glucose serum result or if the test was not taken.
Codes:
>200: result greater than 200 but less than 300
>300: result greater than 300
norm: normal level
none: test was not performed

Description: Indicates the range of the A1c test result or if the test was not taken.
Codes:
>8: the result was greater than 8%
>7: the result was greater than 7% but less than 8%
norm: the result was less than 7%
none: test was not performed

Description: Indicate whether diuretics were prescribed.
Codes:
Yes: a diuretic was prescribed during the encounter
No: no diuretic was prescribed during the encounter

Description: Indicate whether insulin was prescribed.
Codes:
Yes: insulin was prescribed during the encounter
No: insulin was not prescribed during the encounter

Description: Indicates if there was a change in diabetic medications (either dosage or generic name).
Codes:
Ch: there was a change in diabetic medication
No: there was no change in diabetic medication

Description: Indicates if there was any diabetic medication prescribed.
Codes:
Yes: diabetic medication was prescribed during the encounter
No: no diabetic medication was not prescribed during the encounter

Description: Patient readmitted within 30 days of discharge.
Codes:
Yes: if the patient was readmitted
No: no record of readmission.
